document_data.name: S'repic
document_data.mainbody: '''S'repic''' was a species of carnivorous and scavenging [[fish]] found in the [[Sleepy Lake]] of the [[Malatran Plateau]] in [[Kara-Tur]].
document_data.Description: S'repic were large slender fish of huge shiny [[silver]] scales. Most specimens reached {{SI|4'|'"|long=yes}} in length.
document_data.Ecology:
The fish were dangerous flesh-eating creatures that often schooled under the floating raft villages of the [[Nubari]] [[Zantira]] tribe, waiting for food to be dropped into the lake. Locals believed that S'repic not only ate scavenged human food, but also disobedient Zantira children.

S'repic were hunted by the Zantira [[spear]]fishers for their delicious meat and huge bright silver scales, used for decorations and accessories.
